page.title: 14THE DUKE OF KENT'S VISIT
page.content:
On the 9th of July the{Duke of Kent came to the{Westcroft Estate}to celebrate it's{50th anniversary.}He came at 3.20pm. He was talking to Mrs May then he made a speech to the people and a lady called June played 'God Save The Queen' on her keyboard. Then he planted a new tree and a girl presented a rose to him on a silver tray. He asked her "Were you the girl who presented me with the rose last time?". Then the newspaper reporter took a photograph of them. The Duke of Kent walked into the Kent Hall and he had a drink. Children were not allowed into the hall but outside they had drink and food.
by Claire Ryan
